intro: Angelica tsinlingensis, commonly known as the Tsingling angelica, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its rarity and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
